channel.title: Adding new map area? wtf did i do Pi 317
channel.description:
OK, i added i believe 509 map area? [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/2s62a7d.png[/img] I added this onto my client file. client>sprites>
and when i compiled, map area still the same? [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/rab5tz.png[/img]
please help

item.title: Adding new map area? wtf did i do Pi 317
item.dc:creator: @Army123 Army123
item.description:
@Army123 wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

Also, when you add images to your cache via Cache Suite, you have to make the backgrounds transparent. Just edit another image with the pink color and copy and paste and what not.

wait, so all i have to do is color the white pink???

item.title: Adding new map area? wtf did i do Pi 317
item.dc:creator: @Army123 Army123
item.description:
@Army123 wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

^ That won’t affect anything, just click yes. But in this case, you don’t need to edit the cache to change it. Just search on Google on “How to change mapback”.

ok i did what you told me, now how do i fix this?..

item.title: Adding new map area? wtf did i do Pi 317
item.dc:creator: @Army123 Army123
item.description:
@Army123 wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

That’s because it’s loaded from the cache, you can see by using Tom’s Cache Suite. There have been a few tutorials on changing it on R-S. Just simply Google it.

yes, i know, but i get this error message, and if i click yes, i cant edit my media cache anymore.
i know this beacuse i clicked yes before and it wouldnt let me edit the media cache again, so i had to paste my backup client file.
this is the message:

2h2qpg9.png643×667

Read full topic
